{{book | title=Tolkien at Exeter College:
How an Oxford undergraduate created Middle-earth | image = Tolkien at Exeter College 2014.png | author=[[John Garth]] | publisher=Exeter College, Oxford | date=September [[2014]] | format=Paperback | pages=64 | isbn=978-1739216504 }} '''''Tolkien at Exeter College: How an Oxford undergraduate created Middle-earth''''' is a biography booklet about [[J.R.R. Tolkien]], written by [[John Garth]] and published in [[2014]]. The booklet gives an account of Tolkien's university life at Exeter College, going from peacetime into war, and tells the process of his early myth-making. It is practically an extension of Garth's larger work ''[[Tolkien and the Great War]]''. It includes several previously unseen sketches and photos. The book was revised and redesigned in [[2022]], including some more information and images. ==From the publisher== {{blockquote|Tolkien at Exeter College: How an Oxford undergraduate created Middle-earth is the story of JRR Tolkien’s life as an undergraduate at Exeter College, from peacetime into war. It is also the tale of how he first created his mythological world in 1914–15. Rich with archive material, it includes more than 40 images, including previously unseen original sketches by and photographs of Tolkien. The 64-page booklet complements and adds significantly to the account in Tolkien and the Great War. Tolkien at Exeter College is essential reading for anyone interested in Tolkien, Oxford, and the histories of Britain and of Middle-earth.}} ==Publication history and gallery== File:Tolkien at Exeter College 2014.png|2014 first edition File:Tolkien at Exeter College 2022.jpeg|2022 second edition * Exeter College, paperback ([[2014]]), pp. 64. * Exeter College, paperback ([[2022]]), pp. 68.
